Elven Lineage.name: Elven Lineage
Elven Lineage.description: You are part of a lineage that grants you supernatural abilities.

results.1-1: Illusory butterflies flutter around you while you take a Short or Long Rest.
results.2-2: Flowers bloom from your hair each dawn.
results.3-3: You faintly smell of cinnamon, lavender, nutmeg, or another comforting herb or spice.
results.4-4: Your shadow dances while no one is looking directly at it.
results.5-5: Horns or antlers sprout from your head.
results.6-6: Your skin and hair change color each dawn.

results.1-1: Red. Failed Save: 12d6 fire damage. Successful Save: Half as much damage. Additional Effects: Nonmagical ranged attacks can’t pass through this layer, which is destroyed if it takes at least 25 Cold damage.
results.2-2: Orange. Failed Save: 12d6 acid damage. Successful Save: Half as much damage. Additional Effects: Magical ranged attacks can’t pass through this layer, which is destroyed by a strong wind (such as the one created by Gust of Wind).
results.3-3: Yellow. Failed Save: 12d6 lightning damage. Successful Save: Half as much damage. Additional Effects: The layer is destroyed if it takes at least 60 force damage.
results.4-4: Green. Failed Save: 12d6 poison damage. Successful Save: Half as much damage. Additional Effects: A Passwall spell, or another spell of equal or greater level that can open a portal on a solid surface, destroys this layer.
results.5-5: Blue. Failed Save: 12d6 cold damage. Successful Save: Half as much damage. Additional Effects: The layer is destroyed if it takes at least 25 Fire damage.
results.6-6: Indigo. Failed Save: The target has the Restrained condition and makes a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves three times, the condition ends. If it fails three times, it has the Petrified condition until it is freed by an effect like the Greater Restoration spell. The successes and failures needn’t be consecutive; keep track of both until the target collects three of a kind. Additional Effects: Spells can’t be cast through this layer, which is destroyed by Bright Light shed by the Daylight spell.
results.7-7: Violet. Failed Save: The target has the Blinded condition and makes a Wisdom saving throw at the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the condition ends. On a failed save, the condition ends, and the creature teleports to another plane of existence (DM’s choice). Additional Effects: This layer is destroyed by Dispel Magic.

results.1-4: Roll on this table at the start of each of your turns for the next minute, ignoring this result on subsequent rolls.
results.5-8: A creature that is Friendly toward you appears in a random unoccupied space within 60 feet of you. The creature is under the DM’s control and disappears 1 minute later. Roll [[/r 1d4]] to determine the creature: on a 1, a Modron Duodrone appears; on a 2, a Flumph appears; on a 3, a Modron Monodrone appears; on a 4, a Unicorn appears. See the Monster Manual for the creature’s stat block.
results.9-12: For the next minute, you regain 5 Hit Points at the start of each of your turns.
results.13-16: Creatures have Disadvantage on saving throws against the next spell you cast in the next minute that involves a saving throw.
results.17-20: You are subjected to an effect that lasts for 1 minute unless its description says otherwise. Roll [[/r 1d8]] to determine the effect: on a 1, you’re surrounded by faint, ethereal music only you and creatures within 5 feet of you can hear; on a 2, your size increases by one size category; on a 3, you grow a long beard made of feathers that remains until you sneeze, at which point the feathers explode from your face and vanish; on a 4, you must shout when you speak; on a 5, illusory butterflies flutter in the air within 10 feet of you; on a 6, an eye appears on your forehead, granting you Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks; on an 7, pink bubbles float out of your mouth whenever you speak; on an 8, your skin turns a vibrant shade of blue for 24 hours or until the effect is ended by a Remove Curse spell.
results.21-24: For the next minute, all your spells with a casting time of an action have a casting time of a Bonus Action.
results.25-28: You are transported to the Astral Plane until the end of your next turn. You then return to the space you previously occupied or the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.
results.29-32: The next time you cast a spell that deals damage within the next minute, don’t roll the spell’s damage dice for the damage. Instead use the highest number possible for each damage die.
results.33-36: You have Resistance to all damage for the next minute.
results.37-40: You turn into a potted plant until the start of your next turn. While you’re a plant, you have the &Reference[Incapacitated] condition and have Vulnerability to all damage. If you drop to 0 Hit Points, your pot breaks, and your form reverts.
results.41-44: For the next minute, you can teleport up to 20 feet as a Bonus Action on each of your turns.
results.45-48: You and up to three creatures you choose within 30 feet of you have the Invisible condition for 1 minute. This invisibility ends on a creature immediately after it makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.
results.49-52: A spectral shield hovers near you for the next minute, granting you a +2 bonus to AC and immunity to Magic Missile.
results.53-56: You can take one extra action on this turn.
results.57-60: You cast a random spell. If the spell normally requires Concentration, it doesn’t require Concentration in this case; the spell lasts for its full duration. Roll [[/r 1d10]] to determine the spell: on a 1, Confusion; on a 2, Fireball; on a 3, Fog Cloud; on a 4, Fly (cast on a random creature within 60 feet of you), on a 5, Grease; on a 6, Levitate (cast on yourself); on a 7, Magic Missile (cast as a level 5 spell); on an 8, Mirror Image; on a 9, Polymorph (cast on yourself), and if you fail the saving throw, you turn into a Goat (see appendix B); on a 10, See Invisibility.
results.61-64: For the next minute, any flammable, nonmagical object you touch that isn’t being worn or carried by another creature bursts into flame, takes 1d4 Fire damage, and is burning.
results.65-68: If you die within the next hour, you immediately revive as if by the Reincarnate spell.
results.69-72: You have the &Reference[Frightened] condition until the end of your next turn. The DM determines the source of your fear.
results.73-76: You teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.
results.77-80: A random creature within 60 feet of you has the Poisoned condition for [[/r 1d4]] hours.
results.81-84: You radiate Bright Light in a 30-foot radius for the next minute. Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of you has the Blinded condition until the end of its next turn.
results.85-88: Up to three creatures of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you take [[/damage 1d10 type=necrotic]] damage. You regain Hit Points equal to the sum of the Necrotic damage dealt.
results.89-92: Up to three creatures of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you take [[/damage 4d10 type=lightning]] damage.
results.93-96: You and all creatures within 30 feet of you have Vulnerability to Piercing damage for the next minute.
results.97-100: Roll [[/r 1d6]]: On a 1, you regain [[/healing 2d10]]{2d10} Hit Points; on a 2, one ally of your choice within 300 feet of you regains [[/healing 2d10]]{2d10} Hit Points; on a 3, you regain your lowest-level expended spell slot; on a 4, one ally of your choice within 300 feet of you regains their lowest-level expended spell slot; on a 5, you regain all your expended Sorcery Points; on a 6, all the effects of row 17–20 affect you simultaneously.
